The reason processed food makes your skin look bad, is because of Candida.

The one thing NO ONE addresses. I hate that you felt the need to "defend" yourself on your opinion on the way food affects your skin. It's not an opinion. It's a fact.

"You are what you eat" does not come from no where. What you put in your body matters. When you feed the natural Candida in your gut, it becomes an overgrowth. This will cause skin problems. Not just acne. But things like Psoriasis, and Eczema.

Then you have issues with Detox. People with the Mthfr Gene. That can cause you to not be able to process toxins. Which again, will cause acne.

I had cystic acne for over 10 years. It took me 15 years to figure out the cause and to fully heal it. And let me tell you.. it had nothing to do with what I was washing my wash face, how I was touching my face, or whether or not I picked my face.

Every one of my problems was internal. Too many people don't look at that issue.

This is why water helps your skin. Water removes toxins from the body.

I hope someone reads this, and does more research on it. The Western community doesn't talk about it enough. Not everything is only skin deep.

Hi Nicole - Two things you might want to consider for future videos is "Facercise" and any type of acid in your products. Facercise is exercises for your face to keep you looking younger longer. I'm not sure how effective it is long term, but it's excellent for resetting your face after a stressful day. You might not have been doing full-fledged scowling, but there's a tightening up that these exercises help release. (Actors also say it helps.)

So many women's products today have some type of acid, even if it's natural like açai, to remove "fine lines and wrinkles" that it's almost impossible to avoid. This can be one of the contributing factors to rosacea where your skin develops a perpetual redness. I had at least 2 co-workers with this which is how I found out that's why the comedian W.C. Fields had such a misshapen nose. I didn't know this until it was too late and I started developing some of the redness. I finally gave up on women's products and went to using baby soap for my face. While rosacea is more noticeable on people of European and Slavic extraction, it also effects any person of color but is initially less noticeable. Untreated, you can end up with that W.C. Fields nose.

The rest of your viewers may be interested because too often, we don't find these things out until it's too late. 👋🖐👋

I work a corporate job so I wear make-up 5 days a week and I work out right after work so I take off my make up and wash my face right after. So I wash my face twice a day. I have really dry skin and I’ve been having trouble finding a product that gives me hydration and moisture. Do you have any recommendations?
Buy products that have the active ingredient hyaluronic acid in them, it’s very hydrating so it could help a lot. I use Derma E’s hyaluronic acid spray toner, it’s a natural company.

You should watch Beauty Within or Mixed Makeup channels. They have so much information and really teach you about your skin and how to treat it. Its always better to have the knowledge before trying any products. We all need to learn about skin and how it works so we know what type of skin we have and how to treat it. Everyone has different skin and it responds differently to products. You have to customise your routine based on what your skin needs.
